intro: Bonplandia pentagyna, commonly known as the five-angled bonplandiace, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Bonplandiaceae and is characterized by its unique, pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or in the understorey of dense forests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Bonplandia pentagyna is considered a valuable species in botanical research.
